channel.title: Xbox, or PS3
channel.description: Which do you like better? I personally like Xbox better, thats only cause I am better on that, and I am a halo fanboy. :D

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:43, topic:366845”]I don’t get why everyone loves Halo, I’ve never been a fan.

However, Gears of War and Left For Dead are great. And I’ve never been into any of the Tom Clancy games.[/quote]
I don’t get why everyone loves FPS games, I’ve never been a fan.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Zvek420, post:46, topic:366845”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=463044.msg3390121#msg3390121 date=1288827223]
To me, it doesn’t look good, it isn’t fun, and I can’t get into killing the enemies. I can’t get into it at all, not even multiplayer.
[/quote]

All of what you say is based off opinion and no real facts. You’re trying to hard to make PS3 look superior.[/quote]

All of what you say is based off opinion and no real facts. You’re trying too* hard to make X360 look superior.

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

if the halo series was on the ps3, then i would throw my xbox out a window
i love it how people say “PS3 IS FOR RICH PEOPLE TROLL TROLL TROLL TROLL”
well actually, ps3 has free online, and my friend, he has had 4 xboxes , each of them broke down, he is on his fifth one, (in a year span), while i have had my USED ps3 for 2 years, runs perfect.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Anyone can deny.

The majority of my playing time on XBL is with faggot little kids who scream and do random shit. Also, the other amount are people without mics, which I thought came with consoles? It costs money to play that shit?

Whereas with PS3 online play the majority of my time is spent enjoying the game for the amount I paid for the game, not extra for online.

That sounds like a win all the way to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @Zvek420 Zvek420
item.description:
@Zvek420 wrote:

I don’t play video games enough to care about how good the processor or any other technical shit like that is. All I care about is the online play and for that no one can deny Xbox wins all the way. Which is why I choose Xbox. Plus I know a fat gay kid named Kyle who has a PS3 so whenever I think about someone owning a PS3 I think of that fat gay kid named kyle.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

the bank:

1) The new xbox (repalcing all the old models) does as well. And a 250GB HD.

Well that’s nice that they’ve finally come around, but what if you have an old model?

Speaking of old models, having any laptop harddrive work in my ps3 and be officially recommended is sweet.

the bank:

2) The mic is more than $5

Free online play makes that up in 2 months.

the bank:

3) Its not like Xbox live is one centralized server…

The PS3 doesn’t have a centralized server either, you insist XBox has less lag but give no context, what was MITB supposed to say?

Frell:

Xbox is $8 a month

Plus quite a bit more for a whole year. I’ll take a “lesser” service and play intermittently over a few months rather than being dictated when to play if I don’t want to spend the $70 or so for a years subscription.

the bank:

But yes, the Xbox does have superior online play. Besides the fact there IS less Lag (although its still evident), the xbox also includes a mic in even their most basic console.

So Xbox online is better because there’s less lag, and because of what the console bundle offers.

The only lag issues I have on ps3 is with shitty games like COD where network issues are universal, 64 player resistance 2 games years after the launch np np no lag to speak of.

Also as STH mentions, any bluetooth or usb mics will work, and the official ps3 headset can be used as a general purpose bluetooth headset too.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Xbox is $8 a month

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:25, topic:366845”][quote author=the bank link=topic=463044.msg3387657#msg3387657 date=1288624169]

Well, in the past I’ve always voted PS3 because of it’s superior hardware, superior longevity (doesn’t burn up in 2 months like the 360s), and, most importantly to me, it’s “open” nature, letting Linux run on it and such. Then Sony updated it so Linux couldn’t access the graphics card, then Sony ‘patched’ it so that you can no longer run Linux on it, regardless of whether it’s already installed or not. Fuckers. Now I hate them both.

To be fair, I don’t really think consoles are for you anyway. Now, I could be speaking completely out of place here, but you don’t seem to be interested in the games anyway, the actual reason for buying one

That’s probably true, I don’t play them much at all, I mainly use the PS3 for a blu-ray player and media player off my Linux server anyhow.

Another reason the PS3 is better than the Xbox is that you can play it online, unlimited, for free. The Xbox you have to pay monthly to play it online, so it’s online play should be substantially better, and it isn’t. (granted, I think I’ve played one off-road PS3 game online once)
[/quote]The xbox online is substantially better…

You guys all buy into this stupid propaganda about consoles. Media will always portray a competition and no out right winner because if they did there would be monopolization in the industry. I choose to use an Xbox 360, because its what I enjoy and because I never bought into the whole PS3 having superior ANYTHING. It doesn’t. They’re practically carbon copies of each other except for the graphical engine itself that you write for in their respected DKs. Hence, why soem games look better on XBox, and some better on PS3.

It all comes down to preference, and what your friends are playing.

But yes, the Xbox does have superior online play. Besides the fact there IS less Lag (although its still evident), the xbox also includes a mic in even their most basic console.

And the PS3 includes a 802.11N card in even their most basic console. I’ll take that over a $5 Mic any day. Lag would depend on your geographical location, ISP, and the geographical location of the server. So what exactly makes Xbox online play worth so much more (what is it? $15/month?) than PS3 online play?[/quote]1) The new xbox (repalcing all the old models) does as well. And a 250GB HD.
2) The mic is more than $5 and has lasted me since I purchased it.
3) Its not like Xbox live is one centralized server…

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Frell:

STH you convinced me to get a PS3 last time we argued, i just wish my friends had them and i woulda bought it

Me and a co-worker have convinced most people at work to switch. You’re right, the only thing I wish is that more of the people I know had one.

It’s a trade-off though, cause my two best friends have PS3s and we play together often. However, I don’t like having a lot of friends on it because every time I get on people want to talk/play/etc and a lot of times I just want to play alone and relax. I almost never add people I don’t know as friends because of that.

One of the only games I like to play with friends though is Left For Dead 2, and I can just turn on the X360 or my computer to play with friends on that, so that’s good.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

STH you convinced me to get a PS3 last time we argued, i just wish my friends had them and i woulda bought it

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:24, topic:366845”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=463044.msg3387651#msg3387651 date=1288623518]

Well, in the past I’ve always voted PS3 because of it’s superior hardware, superior longevity (doesn’t burn up in 2 months like the 360s), and, most importantly to me, it’s “open” nature, letting Linux run on it and such. Then Sony updated it so Linux couldn’t access the graphics card, then Sony ‘patched’ it so that you can no longer run Linux on it, regardless of whether it’s already installed or not. Fuckers. Now I hate them both.

To be fair, I don’t really think consoles are for you anyway. Now, I could be speaking completely out of place here, but you don’t seem to be interested in the games anyway, the actual reason for buying one

That’s probably true, I don’t play them much at all, I mainly use the PS3 for a blu-ray player and media player off my Linux server anyhow.

Another reason the PS3 is better than the Xbox is that you can play it online, unlimited, for free. The Xbox you have to pay monthly to play it online, so it’s online play should be substantially better, and it isn’t. (granted, I think I’ve played one off-road PS3 game online once)
[/quote]The xbox online is substantially better…

You guys all buy into this stupid propaganda about consoles. Media will always portray a competition and no out right winner because if they did there would be monopolization in the industry. I choose to use an Xbox 360, because its what I enjoy and because I never bought into the whole PS3 having superior ANYTHING. It doesn’t. They’re practically carbon copies of each other except for the graphical engine itself that you write for in their respected DKs. Hence, why soem games look better on XBox, and some better on PS3.

It all comes down to preference, and what your friends are playing.

But yes, the Xbox does have superior online play. Besides the fact there IS less Lag (although its still evident), the xbox also includes a mic in even their most basic console.[/quote]

My bluetooth headset that was bought for something other than my PS3 works just fine on it. So will most bluetooth headsets and USB mics.

What is this propaganda you’re talking about? I have a better experience online with my PS3 than my X360, and I don’t have to pay extra for it. And it’s not like anyone sold me that or tried to feed that into my brain, that’s just how I feel about it.

Inside of the console they could be copies for all I care, I just know that I like the PS3 more. Wireless/Bluray on even the most basic PS3 is something the X360 can’t compete with. Also, the PS3 exclusive games are much more enjoyable to me and push the console to limits that few X360 games do.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yeah, but they’re a massive player in the handheld business. They have something like 60,000 games, some games reaching a million sold in under a week - it is growing fast, and Apple are now the platform holder of one of the biggest, most popular gaming platforms.

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

the bank:

But yes, the Xbox does have superior online play. Besides the fact there IS less Lag (although its still evident), the xbox also includes a mic in even their most basic console.

Not at all. That is complete rubbish. The actual online play is exactly the same. In fact, you actually see Sony pushing their online play further than anything Microsoft have been willing to do, with stuff like MAG (256 Player Online), Resistance 2 (62 player online) etc.

What Xbox live is better at is stuff like cross-game chat, universal matchmaking, and other standard features that are implemented into the console and don’t rely on the developer to implement them. Actual online play is no different.The online service as a whole, including all the surrounding features is better, though, still not worth the money Microsoft charge.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox, or PS3
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:24, topic:366845”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=463044.msg3387651#msg3387651 date=1288623518]

Well, in the past I’ve always voted PS3 because of it’s superior hardware, superior longevity (doesn’t burn up in 2 months like the 360s), and, most importantly to me, it’s “open” nature, letting Linux run on it and such. Then Sony updated it so Linux couldn’t access the graphics card, then Sony ‘patched’ it so that you can no longer run Linux on it, regardless of whether it’s already installed or not. Fuckers. Now I hate them both.

To be fair, I don’t really think consoles are for you anyway. Now, I could be speaking completely out of place here, but you don’t seem to be interested in the games anyway, the actual reason for buying one

That’s probably true, I don’t play them much at all, I mainly use the PS3 for a blu-ray player and media player off my Linux server anyhow.

Another reason the PS3 is better than the Xbox is that you can play it online, unlimited, for free. The Xbox you have to pay monthly to play it online, so it’s online play should be substantially better, and it isn’t. (granted, I think I’ve played one off-road PS3 game online once)
[/quote]The xbox online is substantially better…

You guys all buy into this stupid propaganda about consoles. Media will always portray a competition and no out right winner because if they did there would be monopolization in the industry. I choose to use an Xbox 360, because its what I enjoy and because I never bought into the whole PS3 having superior ANYTHING. It doesn’t. They’re practically carbon copies of each other except for the graphical engine itself that you write for in their respected DKs. Hence, why soem games look better on XBox, and some better on PS3.

It all comes down to preference, and what your friends are playing.

But yes, the Xbox does have superior online play. Besides the fact there IS less Lag (although its still evident), the xbox also includes a mic in even their most basic console.[/quote]

And the PS3 includes a 802.11N card in even their most basic console. I’ll take that over a $5 Mic any day. Lag would depend on your geographical location, ISP, and the geographical location of the server. So what exactly makes Xbox online play worth so much more (what is it? $15/month?) than PS3 online play?

Read full topic
